Metadata.Title: Develop Applications Using Secure Coding Guidelines
Metadata.DirectLink: Develop Applications Using Secure Coding Guidelines

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 6.5

What to Do

Develop applications using industry-standard secure coding guidelines. Train the development staff in secure coding techniques.

How

Perform the following actions to assure that you develop web applications using secure coding guidelines:

  1. Document the software development processes. Design and document the development processes for applications. The actual processes depend on the application(s) and the environment. Include a requirement to train the development staff in secure software development practices.

  2. Train the development staff in secure programming guidelines. TeamProfessor courses provide the knowledge required to develop secure applications. 

  3. Prevent the vulnerabilities explicitly mentioned by PCI DSS in your environment. Determine if and how each type of vulnerability applies to your application(s), and develop processes for preventing each type of vulnerabilities. Design mitigation measures for each applicable type of vulnerability. See TeamMentor articles for help with mitigating each individual type of vulnerabilities:

    • Injection flaws, especially SQL injection
    • Buffer overflows
    • Insecure cryptographic storage
    • Insecure communications
    • Improper error handling
    • All serious discovered vulnerabilities
    • Cross-site scripting
    • Improper access control
    • Cross-site request forgery vulnerabilities
